text: <@U01QVR44MEY> have you ever encountered this issue ?
so the same exact process functions differently in apple mail for example?

Looks like you're using MJML, is that correct <@U018962HD47>? I know they do have their own Slack group, so may be worth asking there if you haven't. You can also use something like <http://Parcel.io|Parcel.io> to test send an email from there to check if it's an MLMJ issue or something HubSpot is doing.
<@U01QVR44MEY> yes only in gmail! <@UKGV272KS> It's not a problem of MJML :disappointed:
<@U018962HD47> I would try to export the HTML Gmail is outputting and compare to what you have pre-send.
Okay, so what is it changing then? That's the key you need to figure out.

in the system pages for email subscriptions in HubSpot (Settings -> Marketing -> Email -> Subscriptions), on the Subscription Preferences Page, is there a way to add options for "Limit Communications to X emails per month" and "Take a 30-day break", or is the only option to unsubscribe from certain lists?
I haven’t seen this built into HubSpot. You could set up a custom page with a form to collect that info and then use it as part of audience building/exclusions.
Another option may be fully customizing the preferences page that HubSpot comes with, and adding a custom module to get that additional info, but I’m not 100% sure.
i appreciate your insights, thank you!
